intro: Dianthus crassipes subsp. serenaeus, commonly known as the Sierra dianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of pink to red flowers. The species belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many showy, flowering plants. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
